name: Creepy crawlies onscreen
description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

key_work.title: Webbed  (2021)
key_work.brief_description: In Webbed players control a spider who solves environmental puzzles by strategically building webs to navigate the native flora of Jagera and Turrbal Country.

constellations_primary.name: Creepy crawlies onscreen
constellations_primary.description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

start.title: Webbed  (2021)
start.brief_description: In Webbed players control a spider who solves environmental puzzles by strategically building webs to navigate the native flora of Jagera and Turrbal Country.

constellations_primary.name: Creepy crawlies onscreen
constellations_primary.description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

end.title: Arachnophobia
end.creator_credit: Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, Richard Vane, Amblin Entertainment and Hollywood Pictures
end.brief_description: A doctor who is deathly afraid of spiders moves his family to a small town where the arachnids are attacking the townspeople. He must overcome his fear to save the community, but it may already be too late! Cast includes Jeff Daniels, Julian Sands, Harley Jane Kozak, John Goodman.

constellations_other.name: Creepy crawlies onscreen
constellations_other.description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

links.description: Unlike Webbed’s adorable Buddy, spiders in films are often sources of terror. In comedy-horror Arachnophobia (1990), deadly prehistoric spiders descend on a small Californian town, tapping into a common phobia to get audiences laughing and screaming.

start.title: Mothra
start.creator_credit: Ishirō Honda, Kazuji Taira, Tomoyuki Tanaka, TOHO, Shinichi Sekizawa and Eiji Tsuburaya
start.brief_description: Shipwreck survivors found on the presumably uninhabited Infant Island leads to a scientific expedition that discovers a surviving native population along with the Shobijin, tiny twin fairy priestesses of the island’s mythical deity called Mothra. After the fairies are kidnapped by an exploitative businessman named Clark Nelson, Mothra sets out to rescue them.

constellations_other.name: Creepy crawlies onscreen
constellations_other.description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

end.title: Mothra vs. Godzilla
end.creator_credit: Ishirō Honda, Ryôhei Fujii, Tomoyuki Tanaka, TOHO, Takeo Kita, Shinichi Sekizawa and Eiji Tsuburaya
end.brief_description: Journalists Ichiro Sakai and Junko cover the wreckage of a typhoon when an enormous egg is found and claimed by greedy entrepreneurs. Mothra’s fairies arrive and are aided by the journalists in a plea for its return. As their requests are denied, Godzilla arises near Nagoya and the people of Infant Island must decide if they are willing to answer Japan’s own pleas for help.

constellations_other.name: Creepy crawlies onscreen
constellations_other.description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

links.description: Mothra (1961) producer Tomoyuki Tanaka was a pioneer of tokusatsu films best known as the creator of Godzilla. He made over 200 films in his career, including crossovers like Godzilla Vs Mothra (1964).

start.title: Nausicaa of the valley of the wind = Kaze no Tani no Naushika
start.creator_credit: Hayao Miyazaki, Isao Takahata, Studio Ghibli, Tokuma Shoten and Top Craft
start.brief_description: Ecologically themed anime from famed Japanese director Hayao Miyazaki set in a post apocalyptic world whereby the air is poisoned and insects engage humans in fierce battles. Princess Nausicaa, the fearless leader of her imperilled tribe, is sympathetic to the insects that others fear and loathe, and understands that she must treat them with respect in order to achieve peace. Typically outstanding animation underscores a sensitive and earnest screenplay that, unusually for its time, steers away from the distinctive violence of anime and sets the tone for subsequent Ghibli studio works.

constellations_other.name: Creepy crawlies onscreen
constellations_other.description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

end.title: Mothra
end.creator_credit: Ishirō Honda, Kazuji Taira, Tomoyuki Tanaka, TOHO, Shinichi Sekizawa and Eiji Tsuburaya
end.brief_description: Shipwreck survivors found on the presumably uninhabited Infant Island leads to a scientific expedition that discovers a surviving native population along with the Shobijin, tiny twin fairy priestesses of the island’s mythical deity called Mothra. After the fairies are kidnapped by an exploitative businessman named Clark Nelson, Mothra sets out to rescue them.

constellations_other.name: Creepy crawlies onscreen
constellations_other.description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

links.description: Like the ohm in Nausicaa of the Valley of the Wind (1984), Mothra isn’t evil – just misunderstood. In Mothra (1961), the giant moth destroys Tokyo to save her fairy followers, who were abducted from Mothra Island by a colonising science expedition.

start.title: Hollow Knight
start.brief_description: Hollow Knight is an award-winning platforming game developed by Australian indie studio Team Cherry.

constellations_primary.name: Silent adventures (Hollow Knight - Education)
constellations_primary.description: Videogames, film and TV usually rely on the spoken word to communicate character and story. It wasn’t always this way. Although we may think of ‘silent films’ as in the past, there are contemporary videogames and films that shy away from using the spoken word.

constellations_other.name: Creepy crawlies onscreen
constellations_other.description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

constellations_other.name: Transfiguration
constellations_other.description: Transfiguration follows the cycle of evolution through a figure who transforms through the elements, from lava and rock to diamonds and steam. Creatures born from the elements have long been part of screen culture.

end.title: Nausicaa of the valley of the wind = Kaze no Tani no Naushika
end.creator_credit: Hayao Miyazaki, Isao Takahata, Studio Ghibli, Tokuma Shoten and Top Craft
end.brief_description: Ecologically themed anime from famed Japanese director Hayao Miyazaki set in a post apocalyptic world whereby the air is poisoned and insects engage humans in fierce battles. Princess Nausicaa, the fearless leader of her imperilled tribe, is sympathetic to the insects that others fear and loathe, and understands that she must treat them with respect in order to achieve peace. Typically outstanding animation underscores a sensitive and earnest screenplay that, unusually for its time, steers away from the distinctive violence of anime and sets the tone for subsequent Ghibli studio works.

constellations_other.name: Creepy crawlies onscreen
constellations_other.description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

links.description: Like Hollow Knight’s (2017) Hallownest, Nausicaa of the Valley of the Wind (1984) presents a world where insects reign supreme. The mighty Ohm are among the giant insects that inhabit the poisonous forests that cover the earth, as the human population dwindles.

start.title: James and the giant peach
start.creator_credit: Henry Selick, Denise Di Novi, Tim Burton, Allied Filmmakers and Walt Disney Productions
start.brief_description: Based on Roald Dahl’s classic story, your whole family will delight in Disney’s juicy fantasy adventure, a wildly imaginative tale about a young boy who journeys to wondrous New York City to fulfill a dream. This is a magical odyssey soaring with amazing animation and original music. Cast includes Joanna Lumley, Simon Callow, Richard Dreyfuss, Pete Postlethwaite. Jane Leeves, Paul Terry, Miriam Margolyes, Susan Sarandon, David Thewlis.

constellations_other.name: Creepy crawlies onscreen
constellations_other.description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

end.title: Hollow Knight
end.brief_description: Hollow Knight is an award-winning platforming game developed by Australian indie studio Team Cherry.

constellations_primary.name: Silent adventures (Hollow Knight - Education)
constellations_primary.description: Videogames, film and TV usually rely on the spoken word to communicate character and story. It wasn’t always this way. Although we may think of ‘silent films’ as in the past, there are contemporary videogames and films that shy away from using the spoken word.

constellations_other.name: Creepy crawlies onscreen
constellations_other.description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

constellations_other.name: Transfiguration
constellations_other.description: Transfiguration follows the cycle of evolution through a figure who transforms through the elements, from lava and rock to diamonds and steam. Creatures born from the elements have long been part of screen culture.

links.description: Like James and the Giant Peach (1996), Australian videogame Hollow Knight (2017) presents invertebrates as complex and sympathetic. The dark, lush world of Hallownest is home to a wide range of insect characters, each with their own values, attachments, and histories.

start.title: Arachnophobia
start.creator_credit: Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, Richard Vane, Amblin Entertainment and Hollywood Pictures
start.brief_description: A doctor who is deathly afraid of spiders moves his family to a small town where the arachnids are attacking the townspeople. He must overcome his fear to save the community, but it may already be too late! Cast includes Jeff Daniels, Julian Sands, Harley Jane Kozak, John Goodman.

constellations_other.name: Creepy crawlies onscreen
constellations_other.description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

end.title: James and the giant peach
end.creator_credit: Henry Selick, Denise Di Novi, Tim Burton, Allied Filmmakers and Walt Disney Productions
end.brief_description: Based on Roald Dahl’s classic story, your whole family will delight in Disney’s juicy fantasy adventure, a wildly imaginative tale about a young boy who journeys to wondrous New York City to fulfill a dream. This is a magical odyssey soaring with amazing animation and original music. Cast includes Joanna Lumley, Simon Callow, Richard Dreyfuss, Pete Postlethwaite. Jane Leeves, Paul Terry, Miriam Margolyes, Susan Sarandon, David Thewlis.

constellations_other.name: Creepy crawlies onscreen
constellations_other.description: This constellation celebrates creepy crawlies on screen, whether they are benevolent heroes like Buddy the spider of Sbug Games’ Webbed (2019), inscrutable arthropods, or arachnid villains.

links.description: Unlike the deadly spiders of Arachnophobia (1990), James and the Giant Peach (1996) adapts the Roald Dahl classic to paint sweet portrait of found family in which Miss Spider, voiced by Susan Sarandon, becomes a loving mother figure to runaway human child, James.
